filters

Class FilterCascade<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • filters.Filter<T>
      • filters.FilterCascade<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - 

    public class FilterCascade<T>
extends Filter<T>
    FilterCascade
    Author:
    Adam Gleichsner This one is tricky. Although it's a filter by standards, it contains a multitude of internal filters. The other caveat is that it can't be reset, so we have to put in an alternative means for resetting a filter (either by index or by allowing access to the independent filters)

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FilterCascade()

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addFilter(Filter<T> filter)
      Method to add filters to the cascade
      void addInput(T input)
      Inputs the new value and triggers the calculation of the output
      void listFilters()
      Method to print each filter in order from filters list
      void removeFilter(int index)
      Method to remove a filter from the cascade given a valid index
      void reset(T reset)
      Resets the filter to a given value, erasing all previous and unnecessary data
      void resetFilterByIndex(int index, T reset)
      Method to allow resetting of a specific filter in the cascade by referencing it by index
